_header: The rose both white and red
Title(s): ‘A lawde…for our souereigne Lord the Kyng’
Subjects: Henry VIII, praise of; Henry VIII, coronation of; occasional verse; political poems
_description: John Skelton, ‘A lawde…for our souereigne Lord the Kyng [Henry VIII]’, possibly by Skelton — eight stanzas rhyme royal

PROE36228.First Lines:
The Rose both white and redeIn one Rose now dothe
                    grow…
PROE36228.Last Lines: …And Martis lusty KnightGod saue him in his right
